title: Practice Exercise
description:
Build a **Movie Ticket Validator** that checks if someone can watch different movie ratings. **Your task:** - Ask the user for their age - Create Boolean variables that check if they can watch movies rated:
  • **G** (General - any age) - **PG-13** (13 and older) - **R** (17 and older)
    • - Display which ratings they can watch **Example output:** 
    Enter your age: 15

Movie Rating Access:
• G-rated movies: True
• PG-13 movies: True
• R-rated movies: False

You can watch 2 out of 3 rating categories!
    **Hints:** - Use `>=` to check if age meets the minimum - G-rated has no minimum (everyone can watch) - Count how many ratings are True

hints.text: Use the >= operator to check if the age meets the minimum. For example: can_watch_pg13 = age >= 13 will return True if age is 13 or higher, False otherwise. For can_watch_g, since everyone can watch G-rated movies, it's always True!
